availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Dandridge C. Graves (Franklin County, Kentucky, soldier (C.S.A.))

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John W. Graves and Eliza M. Graves. Resident of Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Franklin County in 1860. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860. Served in the 4th Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from September 14, 1861, to May 6, 1865. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government on May 14, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 103B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 227.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 492A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Court House Precinct, p. 68A.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0099.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994034, Franklin County Deaths.
